title: Is it better to write an essay of 322 words if the minimum limit is 300 words? - Quora

response.answer_text: Since you’ve met your minimum and there’s no set maximum, you should be fine. However, you ask if it’s “better” to write 322 words and I’m uncertain as to whether you’re asking if it’s better to keep closer to the minimum or go beyond. In this situation (where you’ve met the minimum and there’s no maximum stated) I’d worry less about word count and more about word value. Have you answered the topic appropriately? Have you given answers that illuminate the topic rather than adding unnecessary fluff and padding to increase word total? If you’ve given succinct, relevant answers in your 322 words, I’d say it’s fine to stop there. If you haven’t, then rewrite what you do have or add information as necessary.

In about 300 is fine or maybe very good if 325 words is well stated and supported. We all tend to over speak or over write. Having a suggested or preferred word total reminds us we can’t just go on and on. We must focus-say what we mean as well as we can without distracting clutter and useless filler. Use word count as you would page count-it is a quantity reference, restriction or guidance not absolute. Be forwarned: over 300 words is just that-over 300 words; therefore, being over can only be excused if justified by quality. Somethings cannot be omitted, whilst others can, and others must.
